alert.note: Alert for Gallatin; Wayne; White (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 11:18AM CST until further notice by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Illinois... Little Wabash River at Carmi affecting White, Wayne and Gallatin Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Illinois... Skillet Fork River at Wayne City affecting White and Wayne Counties. .Thursday`s heavy rainfall across the Skillet Fork and Little Wabash River basin caused a sharper rise in water levels for both locations. The Skillet for is expected to drop below flood stage over the weekend, but a continual and gradual rise on the Little Wabash River in Carmi should bring water levels above flood stage during the weekend. With heavy rain expected next week, water levels may remain elevated for some time. For the Little Wabash River...including Carmi...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Skillet Fork River...including Wayne City...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little Wabash River at Carmi. * WHEN...From late Saturday night until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CST Friday the stage was 25.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Sunday morning and continue rising to a crest of 29.4 feet early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
